thread.title: Despite verdict, Doug Snelgrove still faces plenty of trouble
thread.title_full: Despite verdict, Doug Snelgrove still faces plenty of trouble

author: cbc
title: Despite verdict, Doug Snelgrove still faces plenty of trouble
text:
After the jury's not guilty verdict in the sexual assault trial against Royal Newfoundland Constabulary Const. Carl Douglas (Doug) Snelgrove, the officer faces harsh judgement in the court of public opinion and further discipline from the RNC.
Protest follows not guilty verdict in RNC officer Doug Snelgrove sexual assault trial 'Idiot who made a bad decision' but not criminal, says lawyer for cop charged with sexual assault Within hours of the verdict, protests began outside the Supreme Court of Newfoundland and Labrador in St. John's Friday night as demonstrators chanted and held signs outside the courtroom doors.
Signs of the protest remained visible Saturday, as coffee and egg residue stuck to the courthouse, while graffiti with Snelgrove's name was painted on several downtown streets.
Snelgrove, 38, a 10-year veteran of the RNC, was charged with sexually assaulting a woman shortly after giving her a ride home from downtown in a police cruiser in 2014.
He was on duty and in uniform at the time.
Signs and egg and coffee residue remained outside the doors of the Supreme Court in St. John's after protests against Cst. Doug Snelgrove's not guilty verdict. (Submitted Photo)
Justice Valerie Marshall said the case hinged on whether the complainant, who was 21 at the time, had consented to sex or was in a position to consent, and whether Snelgrove knew if she did not or could not consent.
Another demonstration is planned for outside the RNC headquarters in St. John's at 12 p.m. Monday.
Further discipline Snelgrove also has yet to face full discipline from the RNC following the incident.
In a statement released Friday, RNC Chief William Janes said the Crown has 30 days to file an appeal and following any appeal, the appropriate discipline will be determined through the public complaints commission process.
Janes also said Snelgrove has been suspended from all duties, without pay, since charges were laid in 2015, and will continue to be suspended until appropriate discipline has been determined.
He said the RNC does not tolerate inappropriate and unprofessional behavior by officers and supports victims of sexual assault.
"We continue to work with the community in supporting victims of sexual assault and I want to reaffirm our commitment to investigating all allegations of sexual assault," said Janes.
"We encourage any person who has been the victim of a sexual assault to come forward; all complaints will be thoroughly investigated."
With files from Garrett Barry and Marilyn Boone
